subtitle: here in solitude in this time of peace
of meditation I withdraw it deep into
the silent recesses of my being to a
place of utter calm slowly the world
retreats from around me until finally I
am alone walled away from all clamour
and strife there is nothing with me
I am that body I am not thought I am not
experienced I am not the past nor the
present or the future I simply am across
my consciousness comes a constant
procession of thoughts and I observe
them I do not make up these thoughts I
know they come from the universal
subconscious mind and I watch as they
are presented to me I slow the train of
thoughts I examine each of them then let
go on either accepting nor rejecting
Hana nama thoughts come and I asked
myself who is it
that observes this and I hear the answer
thou that art always have been and
always will be thou observes and I
understand divorced from body thought
and experience I still exist as I always
must here then is my true self a thing
independent of all but spirit a
contemplative eye which only observes
and chooses from the thoughts that cross
consciousness whatever I choose is mine
whatever I reject shall never touch me I
need only observe and accept and all
things will be added unto me by a power
which leaps to acknowledge my faith in
my decision I sense such warmth and
Security's might overflow the world
I sense a fusion of my being with the
great Universal subconscious mind the
mind of God I sense the presence of the
father who knows no wrath who does all
things at his child's bidding I sense my
union with his father by immutable an
irrevocable bond I am one with all truth
all beauty all justice all love
